results.title: Village family: a village in Tanjore
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Bob Kingsbury and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: India”
A young Brahmin girl teaches the vina, an Indian stringed instrument, to enable her to support her family and to put her sister through law school. Although educated, she resists the trend to move to a bigger city. Other activities of this village family are shown including cooking and praying at the shrine.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Vikings: warriors from the sea
results.creator_credit: Odin Productions, David Hall and Graham Holloway
results.brief_description: Filmed in Norway and on the Isle of Man, this documentary uses authentic recreations of Viking Journeys and activities to explain the reality behind the Viking Myths, who they were, where they came from, why they took long sea voyages and why their power terrified the world. It is the story of a local chieftain who is holding a feast to honour a guest to his house. Includes 3D graphics of Viking ship design and footage of the Viking fire festival held in York. Recreations by members of the Karmoy Viking Club.

results.title: Vikings of today: a brief tour of Norway
results.brief_description: Tourist attractions and traditions of Norway including the towns of Hammerfest and Finmark; the harbour at Oslo, the merchant navy and a tour of the city; Sandefjord beach and the whaling fleet; a folk dance festival; and Bergen on the West Coast.

results.title: Viking women and the sea serpent
results.creator_credit: American International Pictures (AIP) and Roger Corman
results.brief_description: A group of lonely Viking women build a ship and set off across the sea to locate their missing menfolk who have not returned from an earlier voyage. En route their boat is destroyed and they make their way to an island where they discover the horrors of their beloveds’ fate. Also known as “The Saga of the Viking Women and Their Voyage to the Waters of the Great Sea Serpent” this is a wonderfully bad 1950s ‘creature feature’ by B-movie maestro Roger Corman.

results.title: Viking Sacrifice in Shetland
results.creator_credit: Joy Barrow, Barry Sloane and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
The Viking fire festival which is held every year in the Shetland Islands celebrates the end of winter and the coming of spring. Preparations take many months and involve the entire community of this isolated outpost of the British Isles. As well as the festival itself there are glimpses of the life of the people who live here.

results.title: Viking
results.brief_description: Presents a comprehensive look at the preparations for the Viking/Mars landing scheduled July 4, 1976. The landing marks the beginning of the search for life on the Martian surface, and other scientific experiments. The focus is on scientists connected with the Viking mission, exploring with them the problems, solutions, concerns, anxieties, and aspirations leading to the event.

results.title: Vigil on wheels
results.creator_credit: M. Bhavnani, Films Division, Government of India and V.R. Sarma
results.brief_description: Portrays the job done by railway men in providing safety for passengers who speed across India day and night. Shows the maintenance of locomotives and carriages, and the frequent checking to which they are subject to ensure proper functioning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: M. Bhavnani, Films Division, Government of India and V.R. Sarma

results.title: Vigil
results.creator_credit: John Maynard, John Maynard Productions and Vincent Ward
results.brief_description: A family’s bitter struggle to eke out a living in the harsh environment of a high mountain valley has eroded the parent’s marriage. After the tragic death of her father, twelve-year-old Toss, in empathy with her grandfather’s dreams, compensates for a life of isolation by inventing imaginary worlds. The fragments of reality she perceives are put together according to her own logic. When an itinerant hunter begins work on the farm and is befriended by her mother and grandfather, Toss’s reality is thrown further into crisis. The landscape is centrally implicated in a world of nightmares and dreams. Cast includes Penelope Stewart, Frank Whitten, Bill Kerr and Fiona Kay.

results.title: Views on trial
results.creator_credit: Ralph May, Anvil Films and Richard Warren
results.brief_description: Deals with the objections sometimes raised against measures aimed at increasing productivity in a novel way in the form of a trial. The defendant, representing the indifferent worker who is opposed to better work methods is put up against various witnesses who are called to explode his views. The judge sums up the case, and the jury, the audience, must consider the verdict. The attitude to better work methods must be positive and helpful. Our standard of living depends upon our efforts to produce more. We must work better, but not necessarily harder, if we are to maintain and improve our standard of living.
